sentences.en: Brian has a fascination for girls.
He found great fascination in her quiet, frank manner.
sentences.cn: 他迷恋她娴静 、 坦率的举止.

sentences.en: He had a deep fascination with all forms of transport.
sentences.cn: 他对所有的运输工具都很着迷.

sentences.en: He had a fascination for submarines and joined this branch of the service.
sentences.cn: 他对潜艇非常着迷，因此加入了潜艇部队。

sentences.en: He had a morbid fascination with blood.
sentences.cn: 他对血有着一种病态的喜好。

sentences.en: He looked on in horrified fascination as the ship drew nearer to the rocks.
sentences.cn: 他万分惊恐地看着船越来越靠近礁石.

sentences.en: His letters have been a source of fascination to a wide audience.
sentences.cn: 广大观众一直迷恋于他的来信.

sentences.en: I had a theoretical reverence and homage for beauty, elegance, gallantry, fascination.
sentences.cn: 我对于美 、 文雅 、 勇敢 、 魅力,抱有一种理论上的崇敬.

sentences.en: I've had a lifelong fascination with the sea and with small boats.
sentences.cn: 我一生都对大海和小船着迷。

sentences.en: Seeing over a thousand species of fish is part of the fascination of the reef.
sentences.cn: 礁石的部分魅力就在于可以看到上千种鱼.

sentences.en: She completely forgot her shyness in her fascination with what he was saying.
sentences.cn: 他的话使她入了迷,完全忘记了羞怯.

sentences.en: Some people have a morbid fascination with crime.
sentences.cn: 一些人对犯罪有一种病态的痴迷。

sentences.en: The audience watched the performance with growing fascination.
The fascination lay in the mystery of what was inside the box.
sentences.cn: 吸引力就在于这神秘感——不知道盒子里是什么东西。

sentences.en: The fascination of discovery has never left him.
sentences.cn: 他一直迷恋发现的魅力。

sentences.en: Water holds a fascination for most children.
sentences.cn: 水对多数孩子都有极大的吸引力。

words.tran_cn: 迷人的；吸引人的；使人神魂颠倒的
使着迷；使陶醉（fascinate的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: something that interests you very much, or the quality of being very interesting
